poem:
**Maldives Dream**

Between water and sky
crystal tendrils embrace
islands adrift,
white sands whispered with breeze—

Palm shadows draw
patterns in the glow,
while under glass floors
the sleeping sea sighs.

Splinters of starlight
scatter on the waves,
fingers of dawn's blush
beckon another day.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
